html:
ABUJA, Jan 26 (Reuters) - Shares in telecoms group Airtel Africa, Nigeria's third-biggest listed firm, hit an all-time high on Wednesday, soaring the maximum 10% permitted and lifting Nigeria's main stock index.

The main share index .NGSEINDEX climbed 1.29% to 46,529.99 points, a level last seen in September 2008.


(Reporting by Chijioke Ohuocha; Editing by Jan Harvey)
